business.name: Rouh (Soul)
business.origin: Founded after Sumayya's master's degree focused on media + psychology intersection
business.model: Trauma-informed digital storytelling + AI tool for content safety + training for content creators

monthly_revenue.note: Generates revenue from digital productions, but primarily grant-funded. Amount not disclosed

funding_sources.grants: Primary funding source (European Union, Leaders International, others)
funding_sources.revenue: Some income from digital story productions
funding_sources.future_model: Planning to sell AI tool + crowdfunding + international donors

team_composition.gaza_team: 4-5 people in Gaza for Season 2 filming

office.status: Rented office space (initially 6 months with incubator, continued after)

awards: Arabic Digital Content Award (aligned with SDGs)

rouh_mission_accomplishment.label: proud_meaningful_personal_professional
evidence: Founder: 'This was the first time I had courage to start a project and see it succeed'
Awards recognition gives sense of accomplishment
Working with 5,000+ people (various roles)
AI tool first of its kind globally
Website operational: rouhmedia.com

trauma_informed_journalism_philosophy.label: core_ethical_mission
evidence: Master's degree specialized in media + psychology
'Ethical journalism is part of protecting audiences from traumatic content'
AI tool blurs graphic content while preserving context (like 'hijab' for images)
Training content creators on trauma-informed production
Therapy sessions for people exposed to traumatic content

gaza_war_personal_overwhelm.label: deeply_affected_helpless_then_strategic
evidence: At start of war: watched news 24/7, cried at night, couldn't eat
After a while: 'I lost ability to watch. Felt helpless, couldn't control'
'Sometimes I wouldn't open social media for 2-3 days'
Recent Dr. Adnan al-Bursh case: 'Images left bad impression, I imagined how it affects people who love the victims'
Shifted to strategic approach: content safety without losing audience

dignity_in_death_media_ethics.label: principled_cultural_critique
evidence: 'Would you want to see your mother, sister, brother shown this way on social media?'
Israeli media during Intifada showed child's shoe with blood - you understand tragedy without seeing bodies
'We need to elevate our media discourse. Why do we distort images in strange ways? We forget our humanity'
Covering bodies with white shroud is dignified (Islamic tradition)
Graphic content loses audience after a month - both ethical and strategic problem

gaza_season_2_production_challenges.label: proud_collaborative_difficult_conditions
evidence: Worked with 4-5 people in Gaza filming during war
Stories focused on resilience: tailor continued work at shelter, dialysis patient traveled 4 hours on bike
Production challenges: fire zones, evacuation orders, changed locations multiple times
Team commitment: 'Gazans were able to work and continue. Sometimes video upload took 2 days due to internet'
Quality maintained despite extreme conditions

ai_tool_innovation.label: excited_proud_strategic
evidence: AI tool to blur graphic content while preserving context
'First of its kind globally'
Tested prototype with strong results
Different from YouTube/Facebook (which fully block or blur everything)
Considering selling tool to generate revenue for sustainability

financial_sustainability_challenge.label: pragmatic_concerned_seeking_alternatives
evidence: 'Funding from USAID changed, stopped. Projects that depended on it stopped'
'Sustainability became dependent on creating income sources, not just waiting for funders'
Interested in crowdfunding, individual international donors
Considering selling AI tool: 'I'm willing to sell the tool for profit, to fund humanitarian/social side'
'Institutions need to talk about financial sustainability, not just keep providing grants'

bloom_program_post_relationship.label: grateful_but_wants_continued_connection
evidence: 'I'm very happy Bilal reached out. This is first time I've experienced continued relationship after program'
'Usually when you're in a place and leave, rarely does connection continue'
'Organizations finish program, cut ties. Few check if initiatives continue'
Competitive environment in Palestine: 'People view you as threat once you achieve something'
Wants partnerships + recommendations to funders, not just grants

bilal_drift_tracker_support.label: supportive_collaborative_practical
evidence: Bilal shared Gaza aid bottle drift tracker project
Sumayya: 'I promise I'll send you Gaza contact numbers so you can connect'
Will connect him to Egypt contacts too (Bilal's friend testing in 2 weeks)
'I loved the idea. The humanitarian side winning is easy - when you plant good, people plant good in yours'

journalist_training_therapeutic_moment.label: meaningful_vulnerable_healing
evidence: Last week: ~20 journalists came for training
'I can't describe the atmosphere - they were laughing but had real desire to be heard'
'Unfortunately we hear everyone but no one hears us. Sometimes you must appear strong but...'
'I felt like masks fell from faces. First time I felt I really knew them despite already knowing them'
Therapeutic unmasking for journalists carrying trauma

explicit_needs.evidence: We can't rely on funders anymore. Need to create income sources. Considering: (1) Selling AI tool, (2) Crowdfunding, (3) Production contracts, (4) International individual donors

Need bridge to communities outside Palestine. Want partnerships with organizations that share vision, can provide: (1) Recommendations to funders abroad, (2) Collaborations with similar missions, (3) Expansion opportunities
Interested in crowdfunding campaigns. Need: (1) Window to international community, (2) Platforms that work for Palestine, (3) Training on crowdfunding best practices
Very interested in working with children/youth in Gaza on mental health. Bilal mentioned Schools Without Borders. Sumayya: 'We're ready to explore this. Real need, and we can make real change'

implied_needs.inference: Sumayya feels pressure to 'always appear strong', struggles with war content overwhelming her personally while running mental health media project
implied_needs.evidence: Can't watch news anymore after initial 24/7 watching. Therapist for others but who supports the supporter? Training moment where 'masks fell' suggests need for founder peer support

implied_needs.inference: Has AI tool prototype with strong results. Needs: business model, pricing, legal/licensing, go-to-market strategy for selling to media organizations
implied_needs.evidence: Considering selling AI tool to generate revenue. 'First of its kind globally' = market opportunity. But no mention of commercialization plan

implied_needs.inference: Rouh's trauma-informed journalism approach could be regional standard. Connect to other media organizations, train trainers, scale methodology
implied_needs.evidence: Training 20 journalists, developing global-first AI tool, awards recognition. Could be regional hub for trauma-informed media

implied_needs.inference: Palestine's competitive entrepreneurship environment makes collaboration difficult. Need supportive ecosystem outside local context
implied_needs.evidence: Once you achieve something, people view you as threat. Competition for limited funding creates rivalry not collaboration

core_values.evidence: 'Would you want your family shown this way?' Covering bodies = Islamic dignity. Child's shoe with blood (Intifada example) = tragedy without dehumanization
Master's degree specialized in this. 'Ethical journalism protects audiences from trauma.' AI tool, training, therapy sessions all serve this
AI tool blurs graphic parts but preserves story context. Not full censorship (like YouTube) - 'like hijab for images'. Truth + dignity
Gaza Season 2: tailor continuing work at shelter, dialysis patient on bike 4 hours. Not victim narratives - survival and agency stories
Selling AI tool to fund humanitarian work = social enterprise thinking. 'Can't wait for funders.' Crowdfunding interest. Strategic independence
'First time I've experienced continued relationship after program.' Critiques transactional program model. Values long-term partnerships
On Bilal's drift tracker: 'When you plant good in people's paths, they plant good in yours.' Islamic reciprocity concept

interest_level.label: pragmatically_interested_seeking_alternatives_to_grants
evidence: Explicitly seeking financial sustainability beyond grants
Open to new models: crowdfunding, selling AI tool, partnerships
Values continued relationships over transactional programs
Wants international network connections
Cooperative model not discussed but aligns with: sustainability seeking, collaboration values, moving beyond grant dependency
interest_level.note: Revenue-share cooperative could appeal IF framed as: alternative to grant dependency, international network access, continued support relationships. Risk: Competitive Palestine environment may make her cautious of revenue transparency.

bloom_program_feedback.participation: Completed ACSI3 Bootcamp with Leaders International + EU funding
most_valuable: Initial grant helped establish Rouh foundation
critical_feedback: Usually programs cut ties after completion - 'rarely does connection continue'
Organizations don't check if initiatives continue after program
Need long-term partnerships, not just initial support
Wants recommendations to international funders, not just local grants
Institutions should address financial sustainability, not just provide endless grants
appreciation: 'Very happy Bilal reached out - first time experiencing continued relationship'
'This is rare - usually when you leave a place, connection ends'

readiness_assessment.reasoning: Strong mission-driven media + mental health innovation, operating business with 5 FT team + office, awards recognition, proven Gaza production under extreme conditions, AI tool development (global first), values-aligned (dignity, trauma-informed, sustainability-seeking). Strengths: Operating at scale (5,000+ people engaged), revenue-generating (some), seeking alternatives to grant dependency, collaborative mindset (supported Bilal's drift tracker, wants partnerships), continued relationship values. Challenges: Revenue amount unclear, competitive Palestine environment, financial sustainability not yet achieved, primarily grant-funded. Moderate-high cooperative fit: Seeks sustainability beyond grants, values long-term relationships, open to new models (crowdfunding, social enterprise). Palestine representation, trauma-informed media expertise, mental health + journalism intersection.

support_needed: AI tool commercialization strategy (pricing, licensing, go-to-market)
International funder network access (Sumayya's top request)
Gaza mental health partnerships (Schools Without Borders connection)
Social enterprise model consulting (selling AI tool to fund humanitarian side)
recommendation.unique_value: Trauma-informed journalism expertise, mental health + media intersection, AI tool innovation (global first for content safety), Palestine Hebron representation, Gaza production under war conditions, dignity-centered ethics, resilience storytelling, awards recognition, journalist training capacity, therapy session facilitation, Islamic dignity framework
recommendation.special_note: Sumayya explicitly critiqued typical program model: 'Organizations cut ties after program, rarely check if initiatives continue.' Her appreciation for Bilal's continued outreach ('first time experiencing this') shows: cooperative's long-term relationship model would be major value proposition for her. She's seeking: (1) Financial sustainability beyond grants, (2) International network access, (3) Continued partnerships. Cooperative addresses all three.

schools_without_borders_gaza_mental_heal.description: Bilal connected Sumayya to Schools Without Borders (SWB) working with children in Gaza. SWB needs mental health support for kids experiencing war trauma.

specifics.swb_need: Mental health training/support for children and youth in Gaza
specifics.rouh_capacity: Trauma-informed approach, therapy sessions, content for healing, training educators/caregivers
specifics.sumayya_response: 'Very interested. If there's real need, we can make real change. Ready to explore'
specifics.potential_model: Train SWB educators on trauma-informed approaches, create age-appropriate content, therapy sessions for children

schools_without_borders_gaza_mental_heal.action_required: Bilal introduce Sumayya to Schools Without Borders team. Co-design mental health support program for Gaza children.

dalal_neuroscience_palestinian_women_col.description: Bilal mentioned Dalal - works with Palestinian women, sings old songs, neuroscientist working on media influence + psychology. Perfect match for Rouh's mission.

specifics.dalal_expertise: Neuroscience, media psychology, Palestinian women's work, cultural preservation (songs)
specifics.rouh_expertise: Trauma-informed media, AI tool, digital storytelling, psychology + media intersection
specifics.overlap: Both work on media + psychology intersection, both focused on Palestinian context
specifics.collaboration_potential: Co-research media trauma impacts, joint workshops, neuroscience validation for AI tool

dalal_neuroscience_palestinian_women_col.action_required: Bilal introduce Sumayya + Dalal. Explore collaboration on neuroscience of trauma-informed media.

ai_tool_commercialization_social_enterpr.description: Rouh's AI tool (blurs graphic content while preserving context) is 'first of its kind globally'. Sumayya willing to sell tool to fund humanitarian work. Social enterprise model.

specifics.product: AI tool for trauma-safe content (blurs graphic parts, preserves context)
specifics.uniqueness: First globally - YouTube/Facebook only do full block/blur
specifics.target_customers: Media organizations, social media platforms, content creators, NGOs, news outlets
specifics.sumayya_willingness: 'I'm willing to sell the tool for profit, to reinvest in humanitarian/social side'
specifics.needs: Business model, pricing, licensing, go-to-market, legal, partnerships

ai_tool_commercialization_social_enterpr.action_required: Social enterprise consulting for Rouh: (1) Market analysis for AI tool, (2) Pricing strategy, (3) Partnerships with media organizations, (4) Legal/licensing framework, (5) Revenue split: commercial sales → fund free trauma-informed journalism

bilal_gaza_drift_tracker_contacts.description: Bilal developing Gaza aid bottle drift tracker. Needs Gaza + Egypt contacts for testing. Sumayya will provide journalist contacts in Gaza + people who left to Egypt.

specifics.bilal_project: Ocean drift model to predict where aid bottles land when thrown from Egypt shore
specifics.bilal_need: Gaza contacts (know beach access points), Egypt contacts (test launch in 2 weeks with Lebanese friend)
specifics.sumayya_network: Gaza journalists from Season 2 production, people who evacuated Gaza to Egypt
specifics.sumayya_commitment: 'I promise I'll send you Gaza contact numbers + Egypt contacts'

bilal_gaza_drift_tracker_contacts.action_required: Sumayya send Gaza + Egypt contacts to Bilal for drift tracker testing. Bilal update Sumayya on results.

trauma_informed_journalism_regional_netw.description: Rouh's trauma-informed journalism methodology + AI tool could be regional standard for MENA media. Training journalists, creating ethical frameworks, scaling approach.

specifics.rouh_expertise: Trauma-informed production, AI tool, journalist training (20 in last workshop), therapy sessions
specifics.regional_need: MENA media often shows graphic content without ethical framework (Sumayya's critique)
specifics.opportunity: Regional trauma-informed journalism network - train trainers, share AI tool, ethical standards
specifics.dignity_framework: Islamic dignity in death (covering bodies), contextual truth without dehumanization

trauma_informed_journalism_regional_netw.action_required: Design MENA Trauma-Informed Media Network with Rouh as anchor. Monthly workshops, AI tool licensing to regional media, ethical journalism certification.

crowdfunding_international_donors.description: Sumayya explicitly wants: (1) Crowdfunding campaigns, (2) Individual international donors, (3) Recommendations from trusted organizations like Bloom. Alternative to institutional grants.

specifics.sumayya_request: 'Need bridge to communities outside Palestine. Organizations that believe in our vision can recommend us to international funders'
specifics.crowdfunding_interest: Very interested in crowdfunding, sees it as sustainability path
specifics.recommendation_value: 'When organization like Bloom recommends you, doors open easier'
specifics.individual_donors: Wants access to individuals abroad who support mission, not just institutions

crowdfunding_international_donors.action_required: IF cooperative launches: (1) Bloom recommendation letters for Rouh to international funders, (2) Crowdfunding campaign support (LaunchGood? Patreon for ongoing support?), (3) Connect to individual donor networks

key_quotes.on_human_dignity: I always ask people: Would you want to see your mother, sister, or brother shown this way on social media? I want to see photos of people I love where they're alive, not distorted in death.
key_quotes.on_israeli_media_strategy: During the Intifada, Israeli media didn't show bodies. They'd show a child's shoe with blood - and you understand there was a tragedy. They studied psychology. We need to elevate our discourse.
key_quotes.on_gaza_personal_overwhelm: At the start of the war, I was ready to watch news 24 hours. What do you do after that? I cried at night, sometimes didn't eat. After a while, I lost ability to watch. I felt helpless, couldn't control it. Sometimes I wouldn't open social media for 2-3 days.
key_quotes.on_losing_humanity: Why do we keep distorting images in strange ways for journalistic credibility and social media engagement? We forget our humanity.
key_quotes.on_strategic_content_approach: If I lose my audience after a month because they can't watch anymore, I've lost part of the battle. I'd rather present content with less harm to mental health AND maintain ability to bypass algorithms.
key_quotes.on_founder_pressure: Unfortunately, we hear everyone but no one hears us. Sometimes you must appear strong, but there are things on personal level...
key_quotes.on_journalist_training_moment: 20 journalists came last week. I can't describe the atmosphere - they were laughing but had real desire to be heard. I felt like masks fell from their faces. For the first time I felt I really knew them.
key_quotes.on_financial_sustainability: The topic of funders and financial support is key for continuation. We can achieve income through productions, but sustainability became dependent on creating income sources, not just waiting for funders.
key_quotes.on_selling_ai_tool: I'm willing to sell the AI tool for profit, to reinvest in the humanitarian and social side. That's how Rouh can continue.
key_quotes.on_continued_relationships: I'm very happy you reached out, Bilal. This is first time I've experienced continued relationship after a program. Usually programs cut ties - few organizations check if initiatives continue.
key_quotes.on_bloom_value: When organization like Bloom is convinced of your vision and recommends you to international institutions, doors open easier. It's about partnerships, not just grants.
key_quotes.on_competitive_environment: In our country, competition creates strange dynamics. Once you achieve something, people view you as threat. We need real partnerships with people whose goal isn't just financial profit.
key_quotes.on_bilal_drift_tracker: I loved the idea. The humanitarian side winning is easy when it comes to planting good. When you plant good in people's paths, they come and plant good in yours too.
key_quotes.on_gaza_commitment: We're very interested in working in Gaza on mental health. If there's real need, we can make real change in people's lives who are suffering right now.

strengths: AI tool innovation (global first for content safety)
Operating scale (5 FT + 15 PT team, 5,000+ people engaged)
Gaza production under war conditions (Season 2 resilience)
Social enterprise thinking (sell AI tool → fund humanitarian work)
Collaborative mindset (supported Bilal's drift tracker, wants partnerships)
growth_edges: Financial sustainability not yet achieved (primarily grant-funded)
Revenue amount unclear (some from productions, not disclosed)
AI tool not yet commercialized (prototype stage)
Competitive Palestine environment (makes local collaboration difficult)
Founder psychological support (carries trauma while supporting others)
Crowdfunding inexperience (wants to do it, hasn't yet)
International network access limited (needs bridges abroad)
meta_insights.unique_contribution: Trauma-informed journalism + AI innovation, mental health + media intersection, Palestine Hebron representation, dignity-centered Islamic ethics, Gaza war production resilience, journalist trauma support, global-first content safety tool, social enterprise vision (profit → humanitarian reinvestment), regional media ethics potential, awards credibility
meta_insights.critical_insight: Sumayya's critique of typical program model is key cooperative insight: 'Organizations cut ties after program ends - few check if initiatives continue.' Her gratitude for Bilal's continued outreach ('first time experiencing this') reveals: cooperative's long-term relationship model is itself a value proposition. She explicitly seeks: (1) Sustainability beyond grants, (2) International network access, (3) Continued partnerships. Cooperative addresses all three. Her willingness to sell AI tool to fund humanitarian work = social enterprise mindset aligned with cooperative solidarity economy principles.
